definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Each class elects two students to represent them on the School Council.
sentences.chinese: 每班选出两个学生代表参加学生会。

sentences.english: B. Pick out the proper nouns in the following sentences.
sentences.chinese: 试选出以下句子中的专有名词。

sentences.english: In single-dispatch polymorphism, the object that "owns" a method is singled out.
sentences.chinese: 在单分派多态性中，挑选出“拥有”方法的对象。

sentences.english: At least two women must be elected from each province.
sentences.chinese: 每个省必须选出两名女性议员。

sentences.english: This list looks at 10 modern examples of hostage taking.
sentences.chinese: 这份目录选出10大现代人质挟持编列成表。

sentences.english: Selected applicants will then be invited to submit a full application.
sentences.chinese: 挑选出的申请会再通知其提交一份全面的申请报告。

sentences.english: The players are selected by 127 sportswriters and broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 最佳阵容是由127名体育记者和评论员选出来的。

sentences.english: The milkman selected the spotted cows, from among a herd of two hundred.
sentences.chinese: 牛奶商从一群200头牛中选出有斑点的牛。

sentences.english: State the name of the piece.
We also elect congressmen from single-member districts.
sentences.chinese: 国会议员也是从每区一票的选举中选出的。

sentences.english: The world is but a large prison, out of which some sre daily selected for execution. ---W. Raleigh.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界不过是一座大监狱，每天选出一些人被处决。

sentences.english: The TLC conditions of each drug were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 选出每味药的薄层层析各项条件。

sentences.english: The new grape variety '90-1' was selected from the bud mutation of 'Zhana'.
sentences.chinese: 是从‘乍娜’的芽变中选出的葡萄新品种。

sentences.english: The students take additional tests to choose the twenty-four members of the team.
sentences.chinese: 这些学生需额外测试，再选出24名成员。

sentences.english: We chose a committee to represent us.
sentences.chinese: 我们选出一个委员会来代表我们。

sentences.english: The Socialists will choose their candidate in a primary vote in October.
sentences.chinese: 社会党人将在十月份的初选中选出他们的总统候选人。

definition: to win an election/to get a position by passing the imperial exam
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to choose/to pick/to settle upon/to decide upon a candidate/to be selected for some role
